article.headline: Longwood 81, American 79, OT
article.story: FARMVILLE, Va. (AP) -- Maurice Sumter scored seven of his 16 points in overtime Saturday and Longwood rallied for an 81-79 victory against American University. The Lancers (6-10), who forced overtime when Clayton Morgan hit a free throw with 24 seconds left in regulation and then blocked two of three shots by American in the final seconds, won their third straight and avenged a 60-49 loss to the Eagles on Dec. 4. American (7-6) was led by Andre Ingram with 21 points and Arvyda Eitutavicius with 19. The Eagles trailed by as many as eight early in the second half, rallied to lead by as many as four and were scoreless for the last 71 seconds as Longwood rallied to tie. The Eagles lost despite outrebounding Longwood 49-34. Morgan added 16 points for the Lancers, Lamar Barrett had 15 and Husein Pistoljevic 12, including a 3-pointer that gave Longwood the lead for good with 1:03 to play.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
